bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 5 June 1891
bibl.idno: Letter: MSS18630, Box 7, Reel 4–5; Envelope: MSS18630, Box 7, Reel 4–5
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: first check, corrected, added DOI and notes

body.p: O'Donovan and Ralph Moore f'm the Cemetery have been here—Edw'd Carpenter & three or four friends of L of G & me (women & men) have sent me f'm Eng: a birth-day gift of 40 pounds sterling—(I am keeping the banker's order for Horace to get it for me, when he comes back)—

Am having a pretty fair day—sent you a letter & papers last night—live largely on strawberries—have had eight letters to day & seven of them autograph applications—superb sun and temperature—the dear canary bird (& I love him)—Harrison Morris has just been over to see me—Comfortable as I sit here—fine bouquet of roses & honeysuckles—
